para.text: The Administration shall administer the Fund.
Eligibility Criteria for Projects Supported by the Fund.

Except under §B(3) of this regulation, a project supported by the Fund shall be designed to support the creation of new Tier 1 renewable energy sources in Maryland. For purposes of this section, support may include grants for workforce development programs authorized under Labor and Employment Article, §11-708.1(c)(1), Annotated Code of Maryland.
Additional project evaluation criteria may include the following:
Technical feasibility of the project;
Technical capabilities and experience of the developer;
Financial capabilities of the developer;
Environmental impacts resulting from the construction and operation of the project;
Socioeconomic impacts associated with the construction and operation of the project;
Fuel diversity added to the portfolio of projects supported by the Fund as a whole;
Economic feasibility of the project;
Economic benefits to Maryland;
Job training and workforce development opportunities associated with the project; and
Other evaluation criteria as may be appropriate.

Monies in the Fund derived from compliance fees collected from a shortfall in meeting the required Tier 1 solar renewable energy portfolio standard under Public Utilities Article, §7-705, Annotated Code of Maryland, shall only be designated to support the creation of Level 1 and Level 2 solar renewable energy facilities.
The Administration shall file a report with the Commission no later than December 15 of each year, beginning December 15, 2007.
The report shall detail the following as of December 1 of that year:
Number and types of RPS projects funded;
Amount of funding provided for each RPS project;
Description and status of each RPS project funded;
RECs generated from RPS projects funded;
Uncommitted balance of the Fund related to RPS; and
Identification of loans in default related to RPS.
The report shall detail the following for the immediately preceding year:
Total compliance fees paid into the Fund under Public Utilities Article, §7-705, Annotated Code of Maryland;
All monies credited to the Fund from a source other than described in §C(1) of this regulation;
Payments received in repayment of loans and investment earnings of the Fund that relate to RPS; and
Administrative fees and expenses that relate to RPS.
